block.p: Karen Elisabeth Sicher, the daughter of Francee R. Sugar and David D. Sicher, both of Manhattan, was married last evening to Travis Kyle Jordan, the son of Bette J. Smith of Overland Park, Kan., and Ray Jordan of Denton, Tex. Rabbi Brian Mayer officiated at Wave Hill in Riverdale, the Bronx.

Mrs. Jordan, 28, is a remedial reading and math specialist at the Gateway School in Manhattan. She graduated from Wheaton College and received a master's degree in special education from New York University. Her father is a vice president and institutional bond salesman at Salomon Smith Barney in Manhattan. Her mother is a learning specialist in private practice and the director of learning support services at the Dalton School, both in Manhattan. The bride is the stepdaughter of Linda Sicher.

Karen Elisabeth Sicher, the daughter of Francee R. Sugar and David D. Sicher, both of Manhattan, was married last evening to Travis Kyle Jordan, the son of Bette J. Smith of Overland Park, Kan., and Ray Jordan of Denton, Tex. Rabbi Brian Mayer officiated at Wave Hill in Riverdale, the Bronx.

Mrs. Jordan, 28, is a remedial reading and math specialist at the Gateway School in Manhattan. She graduated from Wheaton College and received a master's degree in special education from New York University. Her father is a vice president and institutional bond salesman at Salomon Smith Barney in Manhattan. Her mother is a learning specialist in private practice and the director of learning support services at the Dalton School, both in Manhattan. The bride is the stepdaughter of Linda Sicher.

Mr. Jordan, 29, is a research associate at the Lindesmith Center-Drug Policy Foundation, a policy institute in Manhattan. He graduated from Colorado College. His mother, a registered nurse, owns the Travel and Immunization Clinic, which specializes in travel medicine in Overland Park. His father retired as a sales and marketing manager in Dallas for AT&T. The bridegroom is the stepson of Dr. David Smith and of Elizabeth Jordan.
